alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 11:29PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jackson and northeastern DeKalb Counties through MIDNIGHT CST... At 1129 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Powell, or near Rainsville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Scottsboro, Fort Payne, Rainsville, Henagar, Sylvania, Powell, Section, Ider, Pisgah and Valley Head. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm currently has broad rotation and may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for northeastern Alabama.
